DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate clinical efficacy ( affective cognitive ) patient moderate depression TMS leave Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex ( DLPFC ) simulate TMS , well clinical response 5 session / week apply vs. 2 session / week . All patient receive 15 TMS session initial treatment ( active sham ) respondent participate TMS follow-up leave DLPFC three month .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation Depressed Patients
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize , double-blinded , placebo-controlled , parallel group clinical trial evaluate efficacy two Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation ( TMS ) protocols patient major depressive disorder ( MDD ) . 70 ambulatory patient MDD diagnosis Clinic Department Psychiatry Mental Health Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México ( UNAM ) include . All Patients complete total 15 session treatment four group : A group patient randomly assign receive either 5 active TMS session 2 session per week . Sham control also randomly assign receive either 5 TMS session 2 session per week . Afterwards , participant receive 2 session per month 3 month period . Depressive anxiety symptom evaluate baseline , every 5 TMS session acute treatment phase , end 3-month follow . In addition , neuropsychological evaluation apply baseline end 15 session 's treatment . Sessions apply MAG pro x 100 transcranial magnetic stimulator . Motor threshold set . Sessions apply leave DLPFC 5 Hz , 30 train , 100 % . Categorical variable describe percentages frequency . Continuous variable describe mean standard deviation . Treatment group compare use Student 's T test . Cognitive , anxiety depressive symptom scale score treatment group compare use repeat measure ANOVA .
DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis major depressive disorder Having great equal score 18 point HamD scale moment initial evaluation Treatment free patient Epilepsy seizure risk record Carry metallic object head ( arterial clip , plate , screw ) , eye brain
DOC.keyword: Stimulation magnetic transcranial , major depression , cognitive impairment
